message:
The description of using a cancelation token in the signature or not in combination with StartNew is a bit vague for me. It looks like the exceptions are mixed. After running your code examples I came to the following conclusion 

If cancelation token is included in the signature then cancelation of the token results in:
- task IsFaulted
- OperationCanceledException.

If cancelation token is NOT included in the signature then cancelation of the token results in :
- task IsCanceled
- TaskCanceledException.  

Whether or not the delegate is executing or not. The only difference is that you have to execute ThrowIfCancellationRequested in an active delegate. 

Is this correct?
